intro: Horkelia parryi, commonly known as Parry's horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Horkelia parryi is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
